title: Older people's experiences of dignity and nutrition during hospital stays: Secondary data analysis using the Adult Inpatient Survey
abstractText:
This project examines the treatment of older people in healthcare through the deeper exploitation of the Adult Inpatient Survey (a major data resource deposited at the UK Data Archive).

The project will result in a new set of patient-level, nationally representative findings on how many older people report that they are not treated with dignity and respect, or that they did not receive the help that they need with eating, during hospital stays over the period 2002-2011, and who is at greatest risk.

The outputs will move the research agenda forward by providing a more in-depth and robust patient-level secondary analysis of older peopleâ€™s experiences of dignity and nutrition during hospital stays than has previously been achieved and will provide a basis for addressing apparent inconsistencies in the qualitative and quantitative findings from previous studies.

A key methodological innovation will be the calculation of a new set of patient population weights that we will make available to other users of the Adult Inpatient Survey. Underlying aims include increasing the effectiveness and quality of health services and policy, enhancing the quality of life of older people, and ensuring that national minimum standards (including equality and human rights standards) are enforced.
